SV Acid Rain
Tell Me More

About us

The idea

Our goal is to bring you closer to nature by spending quality time at sea. Be as a liveaboard in a quiet and picturesque harbour or out on the opean ocean, the sea will heal your worries and help you to recharge your batteries.

The boat

Acid Rain is a 39ft steel ketch built in South Africa. She has competeted in the 19xx XXXXXX race and finished in Xth place. She is not only fast, but also very reliable and extremely sea-worthy.

Our philosophy

Wherever we go, we try to keep our footprint minimal and live in harmony with nature, taking time to enjoy life's simple pleasures.

Testimonials

Come as crew, leave as a friend.

  • Tereza

    Liveaboard

    Sailing with Alex had been such a positive experience! He's got this unique laid back yet proactive and disciplined approach, which makes for lovely days at anchor, taking it easy and at the same time enjoying life to the fullest. On passages he was just so well tempered, supportive and caring, always making sure his crew is happy and...well fed. Acid rain classic, please!

  • Jay

    Liveaboard

    Text

  • Diana

    Liveaboard

    I joined Alex and his crew for a passage from Guadiana river to Gibraltar and back, which lasted almost a week. One of the nicest sailing experiences I've ever had! Alex is a great skipper, chilled and easy going and at the same time very serious about safety. He knows the boat inside out and can fix everything there. Thanks to his guidance I completed my RYA Day Skipper course without a problem! Alex adopted an abandoned cat who turned to be an amazing first mate. Very respectful, clean and clever! Both the cat and the skipper actually! ;) If I cross paths with them again, I'll be delighted to hop on Acid Rain for another lovely sailing experience.

  • Zoltan

    Milebuilder

    I planned to do a milebuilder for a week on SV Acid Rain, but due to a lucky accident, one week turned into three and I had the privilege to meet amazing people while on board. Alex is an excellent skipper who never looses his temper and I learned a lot during our 600NM passage. It was definitely not my last time aboard and I'm already looking forward to the next one!

Liveaboard

  • Cost: EUR 35-85, depending on location and additional services (meals, etc.)

Milebuilder

Building miles is part of many sailing curriculums and there is no better way to earn the nautical miles required than sailing in stunning locations. No matter if you are working towards RYA or ASA certifications, we can help you earn those miles in the most spectacular way!
You will be actively engaged in the planning and execution of each passage and you’ll be learning together with other like-minded students.

With the guidance of our experienced skipper, you can also sail on longer passagesor or even do a Yachmaster Ocean qualifying passage (600NM).

  • Cost: Depends on duration - see below for upcoming trips

Diesel Engine Maintenance

This course will help you prevent and solve diesel engine failures. The course will give awareness of the main systems of a marine diesel engine and the ability to prevent breakdown at sea & rectify defects not requiring workshop support. Mechanical failure is the main cause of lifeboat callouts to yachts. This course includes basic maintenance and engine care which will prevent most cases of engine failure.

  • Cost: 99 EUR
